p: All measured parameters were screened for normality and homoscedasticity using Shapiro–Wilk and Levene’s test, respectively. Differences in coral physiology ( Symbiodinium density, [chla], NPP, and C:N) were determined by ANOVA followed by pairwise post hoc Student’s t tests. We tested for the effect of depth and temperature on AP 15N and AP 13C using a Standard Least Squares (SLS) model, where differences between groups were assessed from the interaction term (depth × temperature) using post hoc Student’s t tests on the Least Squares means. The difference between symbiont and host AP 15N and AP 13C (e.g., ΔAP 15N symbiont-host) was determined using Student’s t tests.
